title: Slope
text: Find the slope by counting the rise and run. The slope is calculated like this: $$\frac{y2-y1}{x2-x1}$$ where x1 and y1 are the values of one and x2 and y2 are the valus of the second point.
speech: Find the slope by counting the rise and run. The slope is calculated like this: ; fraction, y 2 minus y 1, over, x 2 minus x 1, end fraction;  where x1 and y1 are the values of one and x2 and y2 are the valus of the second point.

title: Slope Value
text: The slope of the line is $$-1$$. Elimate multiple choice options without this slope.
speech: The slope of the line is ; minus 1; . Elimate multiple choice options without this slope.

title: Choose one point
text: Choose either point. For the hints, we will use $$(5,4)$$.
speech: Choose either point. For the hints, we will use ; times, open paren 5 comma 4, close paren; .

title: Substitute
text: Substitute the values into the point-slope form $$y-y1=m(x-x1)$$
speech: Substitute the values into the point-slope form ; y minus y 1, is equal to; m, open paren, x minus x 1, close paren;

title: Simplify
speech: Simplify the expression ; y minus 4, is equal to; negative 1 times, open paren x minus 5, close paren;
